page.title: 02Housing in Trefriw & Maenan
page.content: Trefriw -hill town- has been a centre of population since early times providing a point of easy access between the upland valleys to the North-West and the main Conwy valley, which is tidal to just North of Trefriw. It enjoyed considerable prosperity during the latter half of the 19C and early years of the 20C as a spa. There are, consequently several large buildings intended to cater for the influx of visitors intent on a cure, and still providing accommodation for the many tourists drawn to this beautiful area. Thus the village has a variety of housing, from original small cottages and some council houses to large detached houses and modern bungalows. Maenan has a mansion, several farms and small cottages.
